stimulusHtml: Purity is a major factor in determining the type of coal used for energy. Which of the following types of coal are correctly paired with a description of its purity and common use?
choicesHtml: Anthracite is considered the highest grade coal because it is almost pure carbon, and it is often used for domestic heating.
Coking coal is most widely available and contains 60-86% carbon, which makes it ideal for use in coal power plants.
Steam coal has a high carbon content with low amounts of impurities, which makes it ideal for use in the steel industry.
Lignite is the most mature and purest form of coal, and it is often used for large-scale power generation.
